projects.name: rnib-eyeware
projects.subtitle: Employed at Zappar Developing a Mixed Reality Web application for use in the Eyeware 2.0 app for the RNIB.Additionally create a similar, stripped down WebAR version.
projects.description: Developed a single-page webAR app involved using the three.js implementation of Universal AR library in typescript. Developed a 3D stereoscopic view which allows users to go through a simulation eye conditions in tasks, levels and 360 video. Used html2canvas to create a gaze-controlled UI system which allows the user to navigate through each section and use the appâ€™s features.

images.caption: The Mixed reality experience begins with a tutorial, teaching the user how to point with the Gaze control UI.
Note: This is a early development screenshot. A view of the eye conditions view with description pop-up & on-screen buttons
To implement 360 Video, I livestreamed HTTP a 4k panoramic video, then used the HTML canvas to capture the media stream to use as three.js CanvasTexture

projects.name: eflearning
projects.subtitle: While at cognizant, I built the UI for the new England Football Learning Website, a CMS for England Football coaching.
projects.description: Built using the Fractal UI framework + ES6 Javascript (with webpack) and SCSS, it greatly improved upon the existing B2C experience, and won Cognizant UK's Project of the Year in the communications Sector. Over the course of this project, I implemented new design systems, a profile biography UI, and advocated for as SVG animation library Rive.

video.name: efl-video
video.alt: screen recording of england football learning website

images.caption: The Hero section of EFL Homepage. Used Glide.js to create sliders and carousels to display CMS content. Customised to fit the EFL design language and additional responsiveness.
Using WebRTC and js library cropme, I created a login photo system with recording and capturing capabilities. This was passed to Microsoft Azure API to verify the image for inflammatory content.
To optimise for mobile devices, the website transforms a large desktop element into a mobile tray which can be expanded with touchmove.

I re-engineered the existing design system for Index Pages. The design updates based on CMS content changes and the filter component, so I used CSS grid and javascript to dynamically manipulate classes.

projects.name: servicelearn
projects.subtitle: ServiceLearn is a browser-based training application built for the hospitality industry, intended to solve the issue of unintuitive, monotonous training experiences which seldom apply to the real-life scenarios which employees face.
projects.description: This project utilises interactive three-dimensional graphics, intending to deliver a richer, more self-directed experience to motivate users. The importance of this project lies in the fact that current online training fails to enthusiastically engage employees, resulting in costly mistakes, re-training required and extra resources.

video.name: servicelearn-video
video.alt: edit of the servicelearn youtube video

images.caption: All the 3D Assets, inlcuding the Kitchen scene were created in Blender 3D and Textured with Photoshop
Mobile-first was the approach for this Webapp. The responsive UI overlays the 3D scene partially with backdrop filter, reducing the connection between the two interactive mediums.
Notifications and achievements are integrated with the 3D experience. This allowed for an intrinsically motivating experience which allows for richer interactions.
The UI was designed so the user could use/view the ui while the 3D scene is accessible. e.g. Information Box, and the archive page/allergen form utilising the laptop/desktop screen width.
The UI was designed so the user could use/view the ui while the 3D scene is accessible. e.g. Information Box, and the archive page/allergen form utilising the laptop/desktop screen width.

projects.name: wristband-interface
projects.subtitle: The A&E Wristband Interface is a IoE Interface which uses ReactJS, GoLang and GraphQL to help NHS staff track & organise patients in Accident and Emergency Rooms in Hospitals in real time.
projects.description: My role as front-end developer was to build a series of interfaces as per designed prototype and use GraphlQL-Apollo to query GraphQL GET and POST the wristband data to and from the back-end. In conjuction with a Back-End Developer & UX Designer, we took on the project over a year with Client Cerberus Security Laboratories to create the interface for the Admin and Nurse Interface, from a prototype to a fully functioning fullstack application/server.

video.name: wristband-interface
video.alt: video edit of secret levels game

images.caption: I used the DeltaTime function to move the stage in sync, creating a surreal obstacle course similar to difficult stage in Super Monkey Ball.

projects.name: secret-levels
projects.subtitle: The Secret Levels is a 3D platformer inspired by the modern platformer Super Mario Galaxy.
projects.description: It uses the three.js for 3d graphics, and Phyx-Based javascript library ammo.js for physics simulation.

video.name: secret-levels
video.alt: video edit of secret levels game

images.caption: I used the DeltaTime function to move the stage in sync, creating a surreal obstacle course similar to difficult stage in Super Monkey Ball.
For mobile devices, I used the Touch API to switch from keyboard to multi-touch controls. The virtual joystick can be placed across the screen, and vibrates for supported devices.
A particle system was created to add stars, to give the stage an outer-space effect. The star sprite was created in GIMP.
For the player, I created a low-polygon character model in Blender 3D.  The face was modelled using side and front reference photos.
